title: Removing a working set immediately triggers background filtering in the package view
description: When a working set with one project is created and selected, the package view is filtered accordingly. However, when the working set is removed, the package view immediately refilters in the background. It is expected that the refiltering should only occur when closing the working set selection dialog, not during manipulation. Additionally, pressing cancel should cancel any changes made to the working sets, including canceling the remove operation.
OB:
1. Create a working set with one project and select it.
2. Observe that the package view is filtered.
EB: At the moment of deletion, the package view in the background should not refilter. Refiltering should only occur when closing the working set selection dialog. Also, pressing cancel should revert all changes made to the working sets, including canceling the removal operation.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Create a working set with one project and select it.
3. Verify that the package view is filtered.
4. Proceed to remove the working set.
5. Confirm that the package view in the background does not refilter immediately.
6. Close the working set selection dialog and verify that the package view refilters accordingly.
7. Repeat steps 1-6 with the additional action of pressing cancel to ensure that all changes made to the working set are properly canceled.
